text: Viroporins are highly relevant for viral replication and pathogenesis, and their requirement in a large number of physiological processes makes their study a field of growing interest (17, 18, 23) . CoVs usually encode two or more viroporins, including the conserved structural E protein and additional ones encoded by accessory genes. The roles of these viroporins in replication and virulence had been studied in detail only for SARS-CoV E protein (34, 46, 58, 60), though roles in replication have also been
